title: (x) date stamp on 1950s and 1960s Fender amplifiers - (similar to) Artistamp {Jackie T}
content:
The attached image shows the letters EF circled in yellow. Fender Amplifiers used to use this font when they put date stamps onto their amplifiers in the 1950s and 1960s. Does anyone have an idea of what font it is? Most appreciated :-)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905091957im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/font_3895.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905091957/http:/typophile.com/files/font_81.jpg) | 108.8 KB |

 [‹ (x) Modern serif and gothic sans - Filosofia, Benton Sans {Brandon S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905091957/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40039 "Go to previous forum topic") [Is Angelina a legitimate freeware font or a rip-off? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905091957/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40007 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mrpicard

comments.content:
it looks like a rubberstamp of Romana Bold - that got extended and heavied up in the imprint.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/romana/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905091957/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/romana/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/romana/")
Thanks, that looks pretty good!! Most appreciated :-)

It just dawned on me - Harold Loehner had a font that may match up. It’s like a rubber stamp Romana...  
Hold on a moment...

Here ya go  
 [http://www.haroldsfonts.com/frontpage.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905091957/http:/www.haroldsfonts.com/frontpage.html "http://www.haroldsfonts.com/frontpage.html")

go to A - and look at Artistamp Medium
That is fascinating, thanks for the follow-up :-)
